Aulonochares tubulus
can be distinguished by its dark brown general coloration (Fig.
1 A-C
), and the shape of the aedeagus, which is parallel sided along its basal 2/3, with cylindrical median lobe (Fig. 2E ).
Body length 5.8-7.5 mm, width 3.1-4.0 mm. General coloration

Named with the Latin word
tubulus
meaning pipe, after the shape of the median lobe of the aedeagus in this species.
